Class CollisionBox

java.lang.Object
greenfoot.Actor
Box
CollisionBox
public class CollisionBox extends Box
CollisionBoxes are Boxes meant for collision detection. They also can be seen as the "hitbox" for an actor. They are not meant to be used as HiddenBoxes. An example of a proper application of a CollisionBox is to model the space a Vehicle takes up in a specific area.

When visible, CollisionBoxes will be of the color red.

Version:
2024-03-08
Author:
Freeman Wang

  • Constructor Details

    • CollisionBox

      public CollisionBox(int width, int height)
      Creates a basic CollisionBox, which is basically a box. Should be used for temporary collision checking, so having it visible or invisible does not matter.
      Parameters:
      width - The width of the CollisionBox.
      height - The height of the CollisionBox.

    • CollisionBox

      public CollisionBox(int width, int height, boolean visible, greenfoot.Actor owner)
      Creates a CollisionBox that is tied to an owner.
      Parameters:
      width - The width of the CollisionBox.
      height - The height of the CollisionBox.
      visible - Whether the CollisionBox should be visible.
      owner - The Actor that the CollisionBox should follow.

    • CollisionBox

      public CollisionBox(int width, int height, boolean visible, greenfoot.Actor owner, int xOffset, int yOffset)
      Creates a CollisionBox that is tied to an owner, but with an offset.
      Parameters:
      width - The width of the CollisionBox.
      height - The height of the CollisionBox.
      visible - Whether the CollisionBox should be visible.
      owner - The Actor that the CollisionBox should follow.
      xOffset - The x offset in pixels, for the CollisionBox's following.
      yOffset - The y offset in pixels, for the CollisionBox's following.
